statement:
Let $f$ be a holomorphic function on $B(0,R)$ (the open ball of radius
$R$) and $f$ is not a constant function, then
$$I(r) := \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \lvert f(r e^{i\theta}) \rvert d\theta$$
is strictly increasing and $\log I(r)$ is a convex function of $\log r$.

[9]{} John B. Conway. [**]{}. Springer-Verlag, New York, New York, 1978.
